publication.abstract: We present a tool that assesses the enrichment of significant associations from genome-wide association studies (GWAS) in a pathway context. The SNP ratio test (SRT) compares the proportion of significant to all SNPs within genes that are part of a pathway and computes an empirical P-value based on comparisons to ratios in datasets where the assignment of case/control status has been randomized. We applied the SRT to a Parkinson's disease GWAS dataset, using the KEGG database, revealing significance for Parkinson's disease and related pathways. Â© The Author 2009. publication.title: The SNP ratio test: Pathway analysis of genome-wide association datasets

summary.description: This can assess significance of enrichment of significant associations in genome-wide association studies. Tests can be applied to pathways such as KEGG/GO, or user-defined pathways to test specific hypotheses.
summary.name: SNP ratio test
